Based on your preference cues, I would recommend watching "The Dark Knight" (2008). This film is part of Christopher Nolan's The Dark Knight Trilogy, which includes the critically acclaimed films "Batman Begins" (2005) and "The Dark Knight" (2008).

"The Dark Knight" has been praised for its storytelling, acting, cinematography, and score. It was directed by Christopher Nolan and stars Christian Bale as Batman, Aaron Eckhart as Harvey Dent, and Morgan Freeman as Alfred Pennyworth.

The plot of "The Dark Knight" follows the events of "Batman Begins" (2005), in which Bruce Wayne (Bale) returns to Gotham City to confront his nemesis, Joker (Eckhart).

In "The Dark Knight," Batman confronts Harvey Dent, the former District Attorney who had turned away from crime. However, during their confrontation, Batman discovers that Dent has been possessed by a super-villain named Two-Face (Freeman).
